Package me.philcali.device.pool.ddb

Class LockingMechanismDynamoDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.philcali.device.pool.ddb.LockingMechanismDynamoDB
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LockingMechanism
    @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
@Generated("org.immutables.processor.ProxyProcessor")
@Immutable
public final class LockingMechanismDynamoDB
extends Object
    This LockingMechanism is backed by a DynamoDB table to act as a distributed locking store. The LockingMechanism can then be used in the LockingProvisionService. The LockingMechanismDynamoDB only requires a tableName, but other parameters can be overridden at creation time.

        public CompletableFuture<LockOutput> lock​(LockInput input)

        Specified by:

      • extend

        public LockOutput extend​(LockInput input)
        Attempts to extend the lock that is in the client control. An attempt to extend a lock that is not in the client control will result in a conflict, surfaced as a LockingConflictException
        Specified by:
        extend in interface LockingMechanism
        Parameters:
        input - The lock information held by the client in the form of a LockInput
        Returns:
        The updated lock metadata in the form of a LockOutput

      • lease

        public void lease​(String lockId)
           throws LockingException

        Parameters:

        Throws:
